Subject: Weekly State of the Market - Industrial Metals (2025-09-16)

Industrial Metals

Executive Summary

The latest Commitments of Traders (COT) data for Industrial Metals reveals a robust bullish conviction in Copper, nearing extreme levels, while other metals present more nuanced positioning. Aluminum shows continued speculative interest, but Lithium and Cobalt remain largely bearish, albeit with some signs of short-covering.

Key Opportunities

  • Copper Momentum: Speculators are aggressively net-long, significantly increasing positions. This extreme bullish conviction suggests potential for continued upward price action in the short term.
  • Cobalt & Lithium Short Covering: While net-short, speculators are reducing their bearish bets in Cobalt and Lithium Hydroxide, indicating potential for short squeezes if fundamental catalysts emerge.

Key Risks

  • Copper Overextension: Extreme speculative net-long positioning (Z-score: 2.103) signals high exhaustion risk, making Copper vulnerable to a sharp correction on any profit-taking or sentiment shift.
  • Aluminum MWP Waning Conviction: Despite strong net-longs, a week-over-week reduction in speculative exposure indicates diminishing bullish conviction, risking price consolidation or decline.

Asset Class Summaries

Copper- #1

  • Speculators:Dominantly bullish with a significant net-long position of 89,766 contracts, increasing by 1,533 WoW. Positioning is extremely bullish (COT Index Long: 88.76, Z-score Net: 2.103).
  • Commercials:Remain heavily net-short (-55,169 contracts), consistently holding a counter-trend position.
  • Implication:Aggressive speculative buying drives prices, but extreme positioning signals high risk of an imminent correction.

ALUMINUM MWP

  • Speculators:Strongly bullish with a net-long position of 10,210 contracts. However, net-longs decreased by 359 WoW. Positioning is bullish but shows signs of moderating (COT Index Long: 75.32, Z-score Net: 1.354).
  • Commercials:Heavily net-short (-10,669 contracts), increasing exposure WoW, indicating strong hedging pressure.
  • Implication:Bullish momentum may be slowing as speculative conviction wavers, facing strong commercial resistance.

ALUMINUM

  • Speculators:Bullish with a modest net-long position of 273 contracts, increasing by 22 WoW. Positioning is bullish (COT Index Long: 72.84, Z-score Net: 0.987).
  • Commercials:Slightly net-long (38 contracts).
  • Implication:Modest strengthening of bullish conviction, supporting current price levels for this smaller contract.

COBALT

  • Speculators:Bearish with a net-short position of -887 contracts. Importantly, net-shorts decreased by 131 WoW, indicating short covering. Positioning is neutral-to-bearish (Z-score Net: -0.197).
  • Commercials:Net-short (-1,301 contracts), maintaining bearish stance.
  • Implication:Speculative bearishness is waning, setting the stage for a potential short-covering bounce if positive catalysts emerge.

LITHIUM HYDROXIDE

  • Speculators:Bearish with a net-short position of -3,601 contracts. Net-shorts decreased marginally by 13 WoW. Positioning remains extremely short (COT Index Short: 85.01).
  • Commercials:Heavily net-short (-10,011 contracts), suggesting strong bearish conviction from hedgers.
  • Implication:Persistent bearish sentiment dominates, though the slight reduction in speculative shorts could precede a short squeeze.
